learning_objective: Identify and describe patterns in data visualizations, such as charts or graphs, to make predictions.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is studying the prevalence of intellectual property rights infringements over the last 10 years. They charted the number of infringements per year and noticed a pattern of increase every other year. Looking at the data visualization, they've hypothesized that 2022 will show an increased number of violations compared to 2021. Help Alex test this prediction by writing a sequence of code that will simulate these increments.",
    "Answer1": "interferencePred := 200
for i from 2012 to 2022
if i mod 2 = 0
interferencePred = interferencePred + 50
end
end",
    "Answer2": "interferencePred := 200
for i from 2012 to 2022
if i mod 2 = 1
interferencePred = interferencePred + 50
end
end",
    "Answer3": "interferencePred := 200
for i from 2012 to 2022
if i mod 2 = 0
interferencePred = interferencePred - 50
end
end",
    "Answer4": "interferencePred := 200
for i from 2011 to 2022
if i mod 2 = 0
interferencePred = interferencePred + 50
end
end",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "Alex's prediction is based on an increase in infringement every other year. This is simulated by adding 50 to 'interferencePred' every even year from 2012 to 2022, which is achieved in the first answer's code snippet.",
    "code_snippet": "integer interferencePred = 200
for i from 2012 to 2022 inclusive 
    if i mod 2 = 0
        interferencePred = interferencePred + 50
    end
end
print interferencePred"
}
